body:
EDIT: @leseb has provided a hotfix image to help with this issue until rook 1.2.1 arrives. To use it follow the normal update procedure for patch releases and replace the official operator image with `leseb/testing:fix-4558-3`. I.e.:

`kubectl -n rook-ceph set image deploy/rook-ceph-operator rook-ceph-operator=leseb/testing:fix-4558-3`

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**

After the upgrade from 1.1 to 1.2 the encrypted OSDs fail to come up.

**Expected behavior:**

The cluster works after the upgrade.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**

Create an encrypted cluster in 1.0 then upgrade to 1.1 and then to 1.2 following the docs.

**Logs of activate-osd**:

```
+ OSD_ID=3
+ OSD_UUID=dad3f9a1-531f-46c4-9a08-86ed73e3268b
+ OSD_STORE_FLAG=--bluestore
++ mktemp -d
+ TMP_DIR=/tmp/tmp.UDQegCH1qj
+ OSD_DATA_DIR=/var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-3
+ ceph-volume lvm activate --no-systemd --bluestore 3 dad3f9a1-531f-46c4-9a08-86ed73e3268b
Running command: /bin/ceph --cluster ceph --name client.osd-lockbox.dad3f9a1-531f-46c4-9a08-86ed73e3268b --keyring /var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-3/lockbox.keyring config-key get dm-crypt/osd/dad3f9a1-531f-46c4-9a08-86ed73e3268b/luks
 stderr: Error initializing cluster client: ObjectNotFound('error calling conf_read_file',)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/sbin/ceph-volume", line 9, in <module>
    load_entry_point('ceph-volume==1.0.0', 'console_scripts', 'ceph-volume')()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ceph_volume/main.py", line 38, in __init__
    self.main(self.argv)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ceph_volume/decorators.py", line 59, in newfunc
    return f(*a, **kw)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ceph_volume/main.py", line 149, in main
    terminal.dispatch(self.mapper, subcommand_args)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ceph_volume/terminal.py", line 194, in dispatch
    instance.main()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ceph_volume/devices/lvm/main.py", line 40, in main
    terminal.dispatch(self.mapper, self.argv)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ceph_volume/terminal.py", line 194, in dispatch
    instance.main()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ceph_volume/devices/lvm/activate.py", line 341, in main
    self.activate(args)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ceph_volume/decorators.py", line 16, in is_root
    return func(*a, **kw)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ceph_volume/devices/lvm/activate.py", line 265, in activate
    activate_bluestore(lvs, no_systemd=args.no_systemd)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ceph_volume/devices/lvm/activate.py", line 151, in activate_bluestore
    dmcrypt_secret = encryption_utils.get_dmcrypt_key(osd_id, osd_fsid)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ceph_volume/util/encryption.py", line 138, in get_dmcrypt_key
    raise RuntimeError('Unable to retrieve dmcrypt secret')
RuntimeError: Unable to retrieve dmcrypt secret
```


**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS with the hwe kernel
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 5.0.0-37-generic
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): 1.2.0 not working
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`): 14.2.4
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): v1.15.6
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): bare metal
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)): Broken
title: OSD pod fails to start when using disk encryption with rook 1.2
